snippet: Dr. Charles S. Hirsch, who had served since 1989, developed the nation’s largest DNA laboratory to help identify the victims of the Sept. 11 attack.
abstract: Dr Charles S Hirsch, New York City's chief medical examiner since 1989, resigns for reasons of health and age; he and his colleagues developed what has become nation's largest DNA laboratory to help identify victims of September 11 attacks.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Charles S. Hirsch, who had served since 1989, developed the nation’s largest DNA laboratory to help identify the victims of the Sept. 11 attack.

headline.seo: Hirsch Stepping Down as New York’s Medical Examiner
headline.main: City’s Chief Medical Examiner Since ’89 Quietly Retires
headline.print_headline: City’s Chief Medical Examiner Since ’89 Quietly Retires
